title: Where did the name 'Emily' come from? - Quora

response.answer_text: As Jan Leusen, explained. The word Ememy also comes from Emily, from the root Aemulus! Emil would be the male version of the name! Or… it could have German roots from the name Emilio, as Emily is the female version.
Emily or Emilia is the feminisation of the masculine name Emil. From the Latin name Aemilius. From aemulus "imitating, rivaling" (related to the word emulate). Source: Online Etymology Dictionary
Emily is English derived from Latin Aemilia a form of Roman Aemilius, meaning trying to equal or excel, this all taken from the root Aemulus meaning rival.
